Technique: PRESSED IN A FORM/MODEL; ENGRAVED; RELIEF
Name: Terracotta of Eros
Description: Figurine of the god Eros standing. With both hands he is holding the horn of plenty. He is wearing a Phrygian cap and he has two wings. The piece is hollow and at the back the buttocks and the wings are indicated.  Remnants of white paint are still visible.
